subject: Learning
title: Teaching Students to Space and Retrieve
description: A quick, practical guide to Teaching Students to Space and Retrieve.

hook.text: Teachers assign homework due tomorrow. What if they assigned it due in three daysâ€”with a review due in two weeks?

buildup.text: Teachers can build spacing and retrieval into course design: cumulative quizzes, lagged homework, and review days.

discovery.text: Low-stakes cumulative quizzes are especially effectiveâ€”they space retrieval across the entire course automatically.

twist.text: Most curricula are designed for coverage, not retention. Rethinking assessment schedules can transform outcomes.

climax.text: When spacing and retrieval are embedded in the course structure, students benefit even without knowing the science.

punchline.text: Don't just teach content. Design the course so students actually remember it.

quiz.question: How can teachers build spacing into course design?
options: Use cumulative quizzes, lagged homework, and regular spaced review sessions
Only teach each topic once and never revisit it
Assign all homework on the same day each week
